gurmukhi: gÍwr khI ibnqI hir kY iek qwl bfo iqh pY Pl h`Cy ] lwiek hYN qumry muK kI krUAw jh dwK dso ids gu`Cy ]
transliteration: Gvaar Kahibintihar(i) Kai Ik Taal Bado Tih Pai Phal Hachchhe|| Laaik Hain Toumre Moukh Kidarooaa Jah Daakh Daso Dis Gouchchhe||
translation: One day the gopas requested Krishna saying that there is a tank, where there are planted many fruit trees; adding that the bunches of wine there are very fit to be eaten by him;

gurmukhi: Dynk dYq bfo iqh jwie ikDo hin logn ky aun r`Cy ] puqR mno mDryNd pRBwq iqnY auT pRwq smY vh B`Cy ]197]
transliteration: Dhenak Dait Bado Tih Jaae Kidho Han(i) Logad Ke Oun Rachchhe|| Poutra Mano Madhrenid Prabhaat Tinai Outh Praat Samai Vah Bhachchhe||197||
translation: But there lives a demon named Denuka, who kills the people; the same demon protects that tank; he catches the sons of the people at night and getting up at dawn, he devours them.197.

gurmukhi: jwie khI iqn ko hir jI jh qwl vhY Aru hY Pl nIky ] boil auTXo muK qy muslI su qo AMmiRq ky nih hY Puin PIky ]
transliteration: Jaae Kahitin Ko Har(i) Jijah Taal Vahai Ar(u) Hai Phal Neeke|| Bol(i) Outhyo Moukh Te Mouslisu To Anmrit Ke Nah(i) Hai Phoun(i) Pheeke||
translation: Krishna told all his companions that the fruit of that tank are really good; Balram also said at that time that the nectar is insipid before them;

gurmukhi: mwr hY dYq qhw clkY ijhqy sur jwih nBY duK jI ky ] hoie pRsMin clY qh ko iml sMK bjwie sBY murlI ky ]198]
transliteration: Maar Hai Dait Tahaa Chalkai Jihete Sur Jaah(i) Nabhai Doukh Jike|| Hoe Prasann(i) Chalai Tah Ko Mil Sankh Bajaae Sabhai Murlike||198||
translation: Let us go there and kill the demon, so that the suffering of the gods in heaven (sky) be removed. In this way, all being pleased and playing on their flutes and conches proceeded to that side.198.

gurmukhi: hoie pRsMin qhw hir jI ju gey iml kY qt pY sr Bwry ] kYbl qo muslI qn ko qru qy Pr bUMdn jXoN Dr fwry ]
transliteration: Hoe Prasann(i)_ Tahaa Har(i) Jiju Gad Mil Kai Tat Pai Sar Bhdare|| Kaibal To Mouslitan Ko Tar(u) Te Phar Boondan Jyon Dhar Ddare||
translation: Krishna, being pleased, accompanying all, went towards the bank of that tank; Balram knocked off the fruit of that tree which fell like the drops on the earth;

gurmukhi: Dynk kRoD mhw krkY doaU pwie hiRdy iqh swQ pHwry ] gofn qy gih PYk dXo hir ijau isr qy gih kUkr mwry ]199]
transliteration: Dhenak Krodh Mahaa Karkai Dooo Paae Hride Tih Saath Prahdare|| Godan Te Gadh Phaik Dayo Har(i) Jio Sir Te Gadh Kookar Mdare||199||
translation: With great rage, the demon Dhenuka struck with both feet together on his chest, but Krishna, catching his legs, threw him like a dog.199.

gurmukhi: kRu`D BeI DjnI iqh kI piq jwn hqXo ien aUpir AweI ] gwie ko rUpu DrXo sB hI qb hI Kur so Dr DUr aucweI ]
transliteration: Kruddh Bhaidhajnitih Kipat(i) Jaan Hatyo In Oopar(i) Aaee|| Gade Ko Roop(u) Ddaryo Sabh Hitab Hikhur So Dhar Dhoor Ouchaaee||
translation: Then the army of that demon, considering their general as killed, assumed the form of cows and in great fury, raising dust, attacked them;

gurmukhi: kwnH hlI bil kY qb hI cqurMg dso ids bIc bgweI ] lY ikrswn mno qMgulI Kl dwnn jXoN niB bIic aUfweI ]200]
transliteration: Kaahn Halibal(i) Kai Tab Hichaturan Daso Dis Beech Bagadee|| Lai Kirsaan Mano Tanulikhal Daanan Jyon Nabh(i) Beech(i) Udaaee||200||
translation: Krishna and mighty Haldhar caused that four-typed army fly away in all the ten directions like a farmer causes the chaff to fly away at the threshing floor, while separating it from the grain.200.

gurmukhi: ieiq sRI dsm skMD purwxy bicqR nwtk kiRSnwvqwry Dynk dYq bDih ]
transliteration: It(i) Sridasam Sakandh Puraane Bachitra Naatak Krishnaavatdare Dhenak Dait Badhah(i)||
translation: End of the description of “The killing of the demon Dhenuka” in Krishna Avatara in Bachittar Natak (as related in Dasham Skand Purana).

gurmukhi: dYq hnXo cqrMg cmUM sun dyv krY imil kwnH bfweI ] B`C sBY Pl gÍwr clY gH DUr prI muK pY Cb CweI ]
transliteration: Dait Hanyo Chatran Chamoond Soun Dev Darai Mil(i) Kaahn Badaaee|| Bhachchh Sabhai Phal Gvaar Chalai Grah Dhoor Parimoukh Pai Chhab Chhaade||
translation: Hearing about the destruction of the four-typed army of demons, the gods eulogised Krishna; all the gopa boys started back eating fruit and raising dust;
